comment: She is very sweet and approachable, but I found it very easy to tune out during lectures. Skipped class sometimes, missed out on pop quizzes and other grades that weren't on the syllabus. Easy class to take, and modules are super easy to fly through.
easy class, very nice lady. make sure to do all the modules, that is most of your grade. show up to class, sometimes she will do suprise activites that are worth points.

Betsy is awful, boring, and a pain to work with. She is not a fun teacher and the Modules are unnecessarily tedious. The chapters are very long and really descriptive, which in turn means that the midterm/final is ridiculously long and specific. She also lies by saying it's not a "physical activity" class but makes you run twice. Hated this class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Make sure you do all the modules and show up for class because she does a lot of participation assignments. Easy class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She barely replies to emails at the end of the semester and is a a tough grader. If you miss a module it hurts your grade. For this to be a wellness class it was a lot more time consuming than expected. Her final exam is okay, but study.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Weaver is a tough grader for it to be a wellness class. She is not lenient on letting you make up a module. Stay on top of the modules!!!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: What a dumb class you have to take to graduate college. I get annoyed by what a waste of time it is. Weaver is super strict about deadlines of it being a PE class. Sort of ridiculous. Easy A if you do the modules and in class activities though.

As long as you do the modules you'll get an easy A in this class, but if you forget even one module the likeliness of you passing goes out the window. You have to show up to class because she sporadically takes attendance and there are occasional in-class fitness days that you have to complete, but her lectures are extremely boring and pointless.

Wellness is a pretty easy class and Weaver mainly cares that you get your work in through bearface on time (there will rarely be a date extension). Come to class on activity days and look at the online powerpoints to study and you should be able to pass without blinking an eye.

Half online/half in class on activity days. Don't expect to ask for an extended deadline. Does not accept ANY late work. Very nitpicky on grades, esp with the living check ins for every module. Be sure you turn everything in on time and you should at least make a B. Midterm and Final are difficult (100 question final) so be sure to study for those.

This was an easy class that is based off of an online program called Bearface. It is important that you don't forget to do the assignments on bearface, as your grade can greatly suffer. I was pulling an A the entire semester until I forgot to do one module at the end(worth 75 points). Just do the assignments&study a bit. Easy material.

Dr. Weaver is a really nice lady but is way too tough of a grader for a wellness class. She also doesn't remind you about your Beartracks Module due dates (your only grades for the class). So, if you're like me and forget to submit one module, you're looking at a C in the class! If you take her, stay on top of your online assignments.
Takes off meaningless points just because, but overall easy A. You only have to come on activity days.

You don't really have to go to class unless it's on activity days that are marked in the syllabus. All assignments are online on Bearface, and graded easily. She doesn't care if you come to class at all. Extra credit opportunities. Super easy A. Played spoons on the last day of class lol. Also there was NO TESTS

Extremely easy A. The assignments are on Bearface, as for all of the WELL1000 classes. Attendance not required, only on in class assignment days which are posted in the syllabus. Keep up with the work, it is very similar to an online/hybrid class.
She was way too hard to be a wellness teacher.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: You only have to go on days of activities and be warned she doesn't participate at all. Everything is online and lots of extra credit opportunities, really easy a.

All work in this class is done through an online program. The only days you really need to go to class are in class activity days because the lectures are pretty boring and pointless since there are no tests. Very easy A.

Easy A. Keep up with syllabus. Attendance isn't mandatory unless its "in-class activity" day which are clearly stated. All the online work is fairly easy to bs. "Check-ins" (6 of them) are the only real big grades and she can't be a little tedious on them. No final.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Trust me, Dont take. This class was such a pain. Instructions were not clear at all and the online textbook was so confusing, she would try to help sometimes but she never really knew how to work it herself. She seems like a nice person but the class was very confusing and the work was graded way harder than it should have been. only C I've received

TAKE HER!!! attendance isn't a grade so you never have to go to class bc all she does in class is read from a powerpoint that I swear you saw in like the 9th grade. Just watch the syllabus and be sure to go to class when it says that there is an in-class assignment that day!

Professor Weaver is a good professor. Attendance isn't a grade so as long as you watch the syllabus and you know when she is doing an in class assignment, and you go to class for it, you will pass. Everything is online and super simple. I only went to class like 5 times all semester and I made an A.

Easy A! All asignments down through Bearface which is for all Wellness teachers. No final exam. About eight activities in class that count for a grade. Other than that, you don't have to go to class and the activities are for everyone and so easy. Other than that keep up with Bearface.. Don't panic it is totally easy!

Potentially one of the rudest professors I've ever had the displeasure of taking at KSU. Should an error present itself throughout the semester, she is very unwilling to help you resolve it. Show up on activity days and do the modules and you should get an A though.

Professor Weaver's class is the easiest class I have taken so far. Attendance isn't mandatory. Only have to go to class on days where there are activities which are stated by date on the syllabus. Lectures are pretty interesting but she doesn't test you on anything and there is no final. Professor Weaver is super nice and I thoroughly enjoyed WELLS

All assignments are due in an online platform called BearFace. Keep up with the due dates otherwise you'll miss them. All assignments are pretty easy, some are just kind of tedious. Some in-class assignments that are worth points, but are designated on the syllabus. Outside of these activities, class attendance isn't required.

With the new online textbook and course material, this class was a headache to take. Professor Weaver did what she could, but this was not an enjoyable class. You will spend more time on the website and watching her powerpoints, than actually doing something productive towards your personal health.

Sweet, but all over the place. Took days to reply back to emails, would assign certain homework and then surprise us with other homework. Class isn't too hard, it's just a lot of pointless work. 500 word essays on fitness, logging fitness activities, etc. She seems to forget her students have more important classes to worry about. Expect daily work
dont go to class. tests are fairly easy. just keep up with the syllabus and do all your assignments

I never ever went to class and I still got an A. Keep up with work from the syllabus and you'll be fine. Tests are online but are still kinda difficult. She's a tough grader but an A is definitely achievable.

I am an all A student and I made my first B in Mrs. Weavers class. She makes you do a ton of fitness assignments that are complicated and her instructions aren't clear at all. When you try to email her for help it takes forever for her to respond. YOU have to read the book up and down to even try to make a decent grade on the tests.

Just do your work. Like seriously if you do all of her small assignments you will get through this class with an A hands down. Tests are pretty simple (and they're online, hint hint) show up on the days there are in class assignments and you'll walk away from this required class with an A. Just do your work.
Professor Weaver is a good teacher, test are easy but you have to study from book as well. She provide opportunity for extra credit which are must if you want to make a good grade.

Although there are ton of assignments, they are very easy. However, follow the directions provided. She will take off points if not done perfectly. Tests are very easy if you study a little beforehand. Study guides and the lecture power points are provided that contain everything you need to besides maybe 3 questions in the book. Optional final.
Pretty straight forward class, tests are pretty easy. If you do the assignments you will get a good grade. Lectures are pretty long, but an overall easy class.

Lecture class. You don't need to show up, but it helps. Everything is really easy. A LOT of assignments, but you can BS most if them if you aren't stupid. She is tough on the assignments, but you can definitely get an A. Tests could be hard if you don't know what you're doing, so look through everything before you take them.
She is easy, do the work and you will pass. It may be more work than you thought but it is all easy and can be done the day before or day of.

Professor Weaver is a great instructor.  You do not need the Text book, only if you want to use them for tests. All tests are online. Labs are online and due at midnight. 3 easy tests, optional final. If you take the final then the lowest test grade is dropped . 50 points extra credit.

Straightforward lectures during class. Explains the important facts during class. However, Very particular when grading assignments, too many assignments, tests are too long, and will not assist you when you need help. Even though she does not seem to care about the students, she takes off points for assignments not done right. NOT an easy A.

This is the most easiest class you can ever take, but this teacher want to make it hard. She tried to be very hard grader in project and assessment. She take this class way too seriously.  There are better HPS 1000 professors better than her.  I would not recommenced her. But she give 50 points on extra credit. Test are 70-75 question long. crazy.
Easy class. Tests are online. Some in-class activities. Didn't go to class very often and still got a good grade. Lectures are boring.

Super easy A. Don't buy the book and don't go to class (unless there's an in-class activity) or else you'll be bored out of your mind. All of the power points are online and so are the tests. Really nice lady, but really boring class.

completely ridiculous class. claims to be based on your own pace and preferences but you get penalized for anything she disagrees with. asked to set your own goals and penalized when they don't match hers. gives 0's for a terrible form system, doesn't offer recovery only tells you to try a different delivery method. ridiculous.

Easiest class ever! Don't buy the textbook. seriously. tests are all online and super easy! There are some in class activities but they are posted on the syllabus. Only go on these days, or else you will be super bored. All other days, she goes over the powerpoints in class, which are online. Really nice lady and willing to help
Super easy A. Don't bother buying the book, I never used it. Labs are easy. Lecture is okay, bur can be boring at times. Exams are online and open for 24 hrs. Definitely recommend for a slack class.
Pretty easy class. Attendance isn't a thing. She posts the power points online. Some assignments are in class, but it's in the syllabus. Follow the syllabus and you'll be fine. Really nice lady!

Professor Weaver is one of the best professors that can teach this class at KSU. There are some in class activities, other than that, do not come when it is not required to (you will be bored). Online tests. They are very simple because questions are online. Do not buy the textbook.

Class was super easy, attend class and you won't have any problems. The tests are all online but there are several in class assignments that you must attend. She is a wonderful professor with a great attitude! She makes learning the material fun. You do need to stay on top of when things are due...I saw a lot of people "not know" something was due
Tests are online. Assignments are online and in class, so do attend class when they are assigned. Professor Weaver is willing help any time needed. Overall, it was an easy class.

Super easy. All tests online including final. Attendance not required but to get a good grade I would go to the classes where she has "activities" on the syllabus. Classes are super chill and she relays info well. Easy to talk to, allows one grade without penalty

Super easy class seriously I never took notes, never studied did amazing on all the test came out of the class with a high A. Go to class do the labs and you will be fine. She gives a ton of extra credit and easy grades.
Very easy, very nice teacher. I also had her for HPS 1190. If you do the assignments (super easy), show up to class, and put just a little effort into the exams you'll easily pull an A.

Mrs. Weaver is a great teacher. The lectures bored me to tears but if you're looking for an A, take her. I made B's on every test, simply because I didn't study - and still came out of the class with a 97. She gives plenty of extra credit. Reminds me of a high school health class or something.
This class was super easy and it changed my life.  I loved it and Ms. Weaver was very helpful and nice.  I got a 100 in this class!

This class is a joke. I made an A on every test without studying. Plenty of extra credit if you need it. I made a 99% in the class. Seriously, my biggest problem with her is that she talked to much and went to in depth, over explaining things. Seriously, easy A for the mandatory HPS class.

Mrs.Weaver is a great teacher. I received a B in her class only beacause I missed some labs and critical thinking assignments.Besides that as long as you read the book and do the assignments you'll pass.Labs, critical thinking,3 test, and the opportunity for extra credit.Also you will need your book.You can not pass this course without the book!
